stories.text:
For some reason, I am more of a visual learner. Podcasts do not work for me. I usually try to find the video content for the podcasts on Youtube and that works much better for me.

Is there any website which curates such content? I subscribe to channels like "Ted Talks" and "Mind Valley", but finding new content on YouTube doesn't work that well for me. (I really don't know what I need to search at times).
stories.title: Ask HN: How/Where do you find high value podcasts like video content?
OpenBSD on the Huawei MateBook X (2020)
Best responses to the YC hacking question

stories.text:
We measure load time, but how about close time? Sites like cnn.com and other content/ad heavy sites often take a long time to close (eg close tab). Presumably because they do some scripting during a beforeunload event or something like that. Is there a way to measure this and reprimand sites that do it?

To test this try:

- open https://www.allrecipes.com/

- to make it even more pronounced, open 4 or 5 tabs of recipes.com

- let it load

- close tab

- if you had multiple open you will see that you can't even quickly close them all because the first close will freeze the browser
stories.title: Ask HN: Why do some sites take a long time to *close
